{B contraptions. Several tables, bookshelves and a

{B with leather straps and metal instruments which
{B sit on top.  This is perhaps a dissection table
{B for studying the anatomy of larger size animals.{x
32782.name: {MLaboratory{x

description: {g     | {8My time is very short, and there is so much  {g|
{g     | {8I wish I could offer, but I must be brief.   {g|
{g     | {8Even as I carve this inscription, the        {g|
{g     | {8armies of Talos are preparing to march upon  {g|
{g     | {8the city of Waterdeep.  They seek nothing    {g|
{g     | {8more than my head for the murder of their    {g|
{g     | {8brethren and I am afraid I cannot elude them {g|
{g     | {8forever.  It is a damnable shame I did not   {g|
{g     | {8kill more of them when I had the chance.     {g|
{g     | {8I wish to disclose to my son Clausius        {g|
{g     | {8that you are not my only son.  You have      {g|
{g     | {8a brother, several in fact of different      {g|
{g     | {8mothers, but of the same blood of Sagacus.   {g|
{g     | {8Take this to heart, as you are no longer     {g|
{g     | {8the sole heir to the Sagacus Hoarde.         {g|
{g     | {8Do not in your arrogance allow the Sagacus   {g|
{g     | {8name to die, for I fear that in your         {g|
{g     | {8solitude it shall, without so much as a      {g|
{g     | {8sigh of discontent.                          {g|
{g     |                        {w-{8Valine Sagacus       {g|
{yThe path circles the tower to the west.  Along the south side are
wild growing orchards and plants which give the impression that this
tower is deserted.  Of course, from the accounts of the gossipy folks
in the taverns, {cBl{8ac{wks{Wtaf{wf T{8ow{cer{y is anything but empty.  {x

to differ. Keeping it down requires a great bit
of concentration, making it a challenge to move
onward. Letting it go will only add to the mess.{x

{y       .:  {8challenge to your own devices.  {y:.
{x
{8The small opening in the ceiling leads up into a room of
sorts with a stairwell ascending into the next level. It
appears that this is the end of the maze, but the trials

{8A small, dark hallway is here behind the door. A

{8The maze is composed of narrow corridors that turn around
{8sharp corners.  The only light available is from whatever
{8light adventurers bring along with them.  This seems more
{8like an underground labyrinth than a section of the tower.{x

description: Nothing can compare to the intricate stonework of
the reptile statues in this room.  The immaculate
attention to detail is utterly mind boggling.  Of
all the intricate features of the statues perhaps
the most impressive are the glowing emerald eyes.
Eerily real, they stare dead ahead, void of life.{X

single rocks sticking from the wall.  The combination of ice and rain

virtual blizzard up here.

Waterdeep.  {x

you. Along all directions you are pulled, though the strongest
remains downward towards the world. With your bearings in tact,
you move through the expanse in hopes of finding your way back.{x

description: {gYou find yourself in the most peculiar of places: atop a great tree
overlooking the city of Waterdeep.  It grows just at the top of the
summit of the hill in which the black tower sits.  To the west, you
can see it in all her glory: the black monolith surrounded by a narrow
curtain wall that seems featureless against the world.  The tree grows
out over a precarious trop off, lending this newfound vantage point to
great danger, save one low branch that juts out over the path towards
the tower to the south.  {x
32961.name: {CA{ctop {8an {YA{gn{yc{gi{ye{gn{yt {GT{gre{Ge {8overlooking the {WCity{x

description: {m
The stairway from the foyer leads down to a large basement
where Dugmaren and his alter egos conduct highly secretive
research necessary to improve the balance of various areas
which fall under his supervision.  Several rooms spur away
from this one, in the four cardinal directions each casted
with an enchantment for viewing the dynamics of the heroes
and the runs they undergo.  The clandestine nature of this
research does not allow mortals here nor does it allow the
luxury of speaking about it, for here lies the secret to a
long earned success at creating and maintaining hero runs.{x
32965.name: {BBasement {w- {MResearch{x

only thing left to do now is enter the last of
the portals and leave this damned maze forever.
{X

{x
{gHere sits a massive four post bed with silk drapes and
a wooden headboard carved with a detailed depiction of
an ancient battle.  The bed looks as if it could fix 5
normal sized humans confortably or maybe a giant could
fit with minor disconfort. A footstool sits here which

Here at the base of the tower, you can finally make out the black
granite material which forms its structure.  An interesting
observation is that the entire tower seems to have been formed from
one solid piece of granite, as there are no masonry marks or block
seams to indicate that it was made from individual pieces.  {x

description: You are in a cramped, narrow hallway. The statues
have been arranged in a single file line, staring
blankly towards the end of the hallway. A pulsing
green glow radiates from the back of the chamber,
but from here you cannot identify its source. Two
torches spark on opposite walls of this corridor,
yet somehow they produce no soot, smoke or scent.{X
32419.name: {yC{8h{wa{Wm{wb{8e{yr {8of {wS{8t{ya{gt{yu{8e{ws{x

description: Mind over matter.  That is what your mind tells
you but the matter in your stomach seems to beg
to differ. Keeping it down requires a great bit
of concentration, making it a challenge to move
onward. Letting it go will only add to the mess.{x

description: {y
The noxious smell is unbearable, but the prospect
of leaving this place fast is appealing.  Forward
there seems to be light, though it's difficult to
tell whether or not it's coming from some outside
hole or from your light reflecting from the walls.{x
32858.name: {8The {cT{wo{Ww{we{cr {rC{ye{rss{8pit{x

description: Claustrophobia is something you do not wish upon any
person or otherwise who attempts this precarious way.
Topped with the unbearable smell, you wonder why you
ever decided to come here but it's late to turn back.{x
32925.name: {xA {rNarrow {8Chute{x

description: {r
This is less of a chamber than a series of caverns set
below the tower. It is not certain what the purpose of

and foreboding, accented with interwoven bands made

a mortal hand for perhaps centuries.  Atop the door

air is somewhat cooler here though it still

of accessing the next level, where you hope

another place in the realms. Directly below the mirror is
a sign reading:  Immortal Viewing Glass - Blackstaff Roof.{x
{yAlong this small dirt path grows exotic flowers and plants that

worn from years of use, and is indistinguishable from the one which
circles the tower to the south.  {x

{*Description{&:{3 Send mortals on a wild..erm..monkey chase through
the tower!  This quest loads 15 chromatic monkies, each monkey
loads a jewel worth 1000 plat, but has a mprog to flee at each
round of combat.  The monkeys only load on the lower levels of
the tower, and dont hit hard, making this quest acceptable for
all levels.

{*Description{&:{3 For heroes only, this quest puts a pretty princess
at the top of the tower.  Participants must race through all of
Blackstaff Tower's mind boggling mazes to save the princess  at
the top.  The prize for the completion of this quest is a up to
you.  Once you activate the quest, goto: 'pretty princess' then
give her as many items as you would like to be rewarded.

description:
His face is wrinkled and sunken, almost ghastly.  He has long,
stringy hair, balding in spots and topped off with a pointed hood.  He
holds a gnarled walking stick and leans upon it for support.  His
robes are less robes than dirtied rags, torn at the feet where he has
snagged and trampled upon it.  He is dirtied from head to sandals, and
smells as if he hasn't touched water in many weeks.  When he speaks,
he does so with a cracked voice, from much shouting that those of his
profession do.
